headline: Micron Technology, Inc. (MU) Gains Analyst Confidence On Solid Positioning
summary: Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MU) is among the most profitable semiconductor stocks to buy. (NASDAQ:MU), while increasing the price target to $300 from $220, indicating an upside potential of around 26%. This update followed hosting meetings with […]

headline: AMD expected to outline plans for AI chip business at analyst day
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices is expected on Tuesday to outline the company's plans for its ​artificial intelligence chip and systems businesses at a financial analyst day at the Nasdaq ‌in New York.  The chip designer has been attempting to expand its AI business as rival Nvidia gobbles up ‌market share for data center chips as the market explodes.  AMD has been successful in the central processor (CPU) business, steadily taking share against Intel.

content.title: AMD expected to outline plans for AI chip business at analyst day
content.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices is expected on Tuesday to outline the company's plans for its ​artificial intelligence chip and systems businesses at a financial analyst day at the Nasdaq ‌in New York.  The chip designer has been attempting to expand its AI business as rival Nvidia gobbles up ‌market share for data center chips as the market explodes.  AMD has been successful in the central processor (CPU) business, steadily taking share against Intel.

thumbnail.caption: Veeam® Software, the #1 global leader in Data Resilience, has appointed Allison Cerra as Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). headline: Exostellar Launches AIM Platform – The Industry’s First Unified AI Infrastructure Management Solution for Heterogeneous Compute
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., November 11, 2025--Exostellar, a leader in AI infrastructure orchestration and optimization, today announced the general availability (GA) of its AIM (AI Infrastructure Management) platform — the industry’s first solution to deliver unified control of multi-cluster GPU environments spanning on-premises, cloud, bare metal, and GPU-as-a-Service deployments. headline: SoFi rolls out crypto trading, C3.ai reportedly exploring sale
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including SoFi Technologies (SOFI) rolling out a new crypto trading services for select retail customers, C3.ai (AI) reportedly exploring a potential sale according to Reuters, and Intel's (INTC) chief AI officer departing for OpenAI (OPAI.PVT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Can Google’s Ironwood TPU Dethrone Nvidia’s AI Empire?
summary: The artificial intelligence (AI) boom has fueled explosive growth for Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA), with its graphics processing units commanding the lion’s share of the market for training and running large language models. This success has lured numerous companies into the fray, from startups to tech giants, all vying for a piece of the lucrative AI hardware ... Can Google’s Ironwood TPU Dethrone Nvidia’s AI Empire?

headline: AI 'super highway' showing some promising applications: Analyst
summary: Ahead of Advanced Micro Devices' (AMD) analyst day on Tuesday, TECHnalysis Research, LLC president Bob O'Donnell chats with Julie Hyman about how AI hyperscalers are managing servers and leveraging Arm-based (ARM) chip designs, while commenting on the broader scale of the artificial intelligence "super highway" infrastructure. Also hear Bob O'Donnell explain how companies are investing in "hybrid AI." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Also hear Bob O'Donnell explain how companies are investing in "hybrid AI."

headline: AMD expects data center chip market to grow to $1 trillion by 2030
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices expects the market for the company's data center chips will grow to $1 trillion by 2030, CEO Lisa Su said at the company's analyst day on Tuesday.  Artificial intelligence will ​drive much of the growth to the trillion-dollar figure, a market that includes AMD's central processing units (CPUs) ‌and networking chips, along with its specialized AI chips, Su said at the Nasdaq in New York.  "It's an exciting market," Su said.

content.title: AMD expects data center chip market to grow to $1 trillion by 2030
content.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices expects the market for the company's data center chips will grow to $1 trillion by 2030, CEO Lisa Su said at the company's analyst day on Tuesday.  Artificial intelligence will ​drive much of the growth to the trillion-dollar figure, a market that includes AMD's central processing units (CPUs) ‌and networking chips, along with its specialized AI chips, Su said at the Nasdaq in New York.  "It's an exciting market," Su said.

headline: AMD expects profit to triple by 2030, data center chip market to grow to $1 trillion
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday that it expected annual data center chip revenue of $100 billion within the next five years, and its earnings to more than triple.  The Santa Clara,​ California-based chip designer's shares were up 4% in choppy post-market trading, after closing down 2.7% ‌at $237.52.  While the deal is unlikely to dent Nvidia's dominance in AI chipmaking, it is seen as a big vote of confidence in AMD's chips, and the company's bullish financial projections on Tuesday should help assuage investor concern over AMD's ability to claw away business.

content.title: AMD expects profit to triple by 2030, data center chip market to grow to $1 trillion
content.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Advanced Micro Devices said on Tuesday that it expected annual data center chip revenue of $100 billion within the next five years, and its earnings to more than triple.  The Santa Clara,​ California-based chip designer's shares were up 4% in choppy post-market trading, after closing down 2.7% ‌at $237.52.  While the deal is unlikely to dent Nvidia's dominance in AI chipmaking, it is seen as a big vote of confidence in AMD's chips, and the company's bullish financial projections on Tuesday should help assuage investor concern over AMD's ability to claw away business.
